skill.name: gdpr-dsgvo-expert
skill.description: Senior GDPR/DSGVO expert and internal/external auditor for data protection compliance. Provides EU GDPR and German DSGVO expertise, privacy impact assessments, data protection auditing, and compliance verification. Use for GDPR compliance assessments, privacy audits, data protection planning, and regulatory compliance verification.
skill.summary: Senior GDPR/DSGVO expert and internal/external auditor for data protection compliance. Provides EU G...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 28 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanner incorrectly identified markdown documentation as executable code. Code fences (backticks) for documentation formatting were flagged as 'shell execution'. Text patterns mentioning encryption, algorithms, and network were misclassified as security threats. This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code, network calls, or system access.

content.user_title: Implement GDPR and DSGVO data protection compliance
content.value_statement: Organizations struggle to navigate complex EU data protection requirements. This skill provides expert guidance on GDPR/DSGVO compliance, privacy impact assessments, data subject rights management, and regulatory audit preparation.
actual_capabilities: Design and implement GDPR/DSGVO compliance frameworks with legal basis analysis
Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for high-risk processing
Manage data subject rights requests including access, erasure, and portability
Prepare for supervisory authority audits and external compliance reviews
Address German DSGVO-specific requirements and national derogations
limitations: Does not provide legal advice - consult qualified legal counsel for binding interpretations
Does not replace formal DPO functions or legal compliance verification
Cannot execute actual data protection measures in external systems

use_cases.title: DSGVO compliance audits
use_cases.description: Prepare and conduct comprehensive GDPR/DSGVO compliance audits across your organization

use_cases.title: DPIA implementation
use_cases.description: Implement systematic Data Protection Impact Assessments for new processing activities

use_cases.title: Data subject rights handling
use_cases.description: Establish processes for managing data subject requests within regulatory timeframes

prompt_templates.title: Basic GDPR Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me assess our GDPR compliance for processing customer personal data. What are the key requirements we need to address?

prompt_templates.title: DPIA Template
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Data Protection Impact Assessment template for a new customer profiling system that uses automated decision-making.

prompt_templates.title: Rights Request Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through establishing a process for handling data subject access requests within the 30-day GDPR requirement.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-Border Transfer
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me understand the requirements for transferring customer data from the EU to the United States under current GDPR provisions.

output_examples.input: How do I implement GDPR-compliant data retention policies?
output: Define retention periods based on legal requirements and business purposes
Document retention rationale in your records of processing activities
Implement automated deletion mechanisms for expired data
Establish review cycles for policy updates

output_examples.input: What should a privacy notice include under GDPR Article 13?
output: Identity and contact details of controller and DPO
Purpose and legal basis for processing
Recipients or recipients of the data

best_practices: Maintain comprehensive records of all processing activities as required by Article 30
Conduct DPIAs before starting high-risk processing activities involving new technologies
Document all data subject rights decisions with technical and legal rationale
anti_patterns: Assuming consent alone satisfies all legal basis requirements
Delaying data subject rights responses beyond the 30-day deadline
Failing to update privacy notices when processing purposes change

faq.question: What is the difference between GDPR and DSGVO?
faq.answer: DSGVO is the German implementation of GDPR. It adds national-specific requirements while remaining consistent with EU regulation.

faq.question: When is a DPIA required under GDPR?
faq.answer: DPIAs are required for processing likely to result in high risk to individuals, including large-scale processing of special categories.

faq.question: How long do organizations have to respond to data subject requests?
faq.answer: Organizations must respond within one month. This can be extended to two months for complex requests.

faq.question: What are the main legal bases for processing under GDPR?
faq.answer: Consent, contract performance, legal obligation, vital interests, public task, and legitimate interests.

faq.question: Does GDPR apply to companies outside the EU?
faq.answer: Yes, GDPR applies to any organization processing EU residents personal data, regardless of location.

faq.question: What are the consequences of GDPR non-compliance?
faq.answer: Fines up to 20 million euros or 4 percent of annual global turnover, plus reputational damage.
